metadata.title: CVE-2016-3078 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple integer overflows in php_zip.c in the zip extension in PHP before7.0.6 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-basedbuffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted call to (1) getFromIndex or (2) getFromName in theZipArchive class.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1
php7.0 - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1
php7.0-bz2 - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1
php7.0-cgi - 7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.4-7ubuntu2.1').
